abbreviations - this pattern is written in us terminology st/sts stitch/stitches slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet tools and materials - 5 mm crochet hook - bernat premium #4 worsted medium yarn - red white and green - yarn needle - scissors final size - the inside of hat diameter is 5 5 cm technical notes *most rounds are joined with a slip_stitch *the slip_stitch is worked into the first stitch of the round not one of the chains *at the end of each round/row is a stitch count in brackets *stitch count does not include chains or slip_stitch joins *link to the youtube video is at the bottom of the pattern hat red round 1 make a magic_ring chain 1 into the magic_ring make 6 single_crochet join with a slip_stitch 6 sts round 2 chain 1 make 2 single_crochet in each st around join with a slip_stitch 12 sts round 3 chain 1 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around join with a slip_stitch 18 sts round 4 chain 1 make 1 single_crochet in the first followed by 2 single_crochet in the next st then 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around join with a slip_stitch 24 sts round 5-7 chain 1 make 1 single_crochet in each st around join with a slip_stitch 24 sts *fasten_off and weave in the yarn tail leaves green round 1 make a magic_ring chain 1 into the magic_ring make 6 single_crochet join with a slip_stitch 6 sts round 2 chain 4 start in the second chain from the hook make 1 slip_stitch in the first chain 1 single_crochet in the next chain 1 half_double_crochet in the next chain then make 1 slip_stitch into the next st repeat to make 6 leaves 24 sts fasten_off and pull the yarn into tie a knot leave a 30 cm yarn the bottom of the tail first spike sew to the top of the hat stem green row 1 chain 4 start in the second chain from the hook make 1 slip_stitch into each chain across 3 sts fasten_off and sew the stem to cut about 45 cm leave an 8 cm yarn the top of the hat of white yarn to tail make the seeds once you are happy with the number of seeds tie a knot and cut the yarn tails short link to video https //youtu be/ign9ywoe0zk if you need help or have any questions feel free to message me i will respond as soon as possible and answer or clarify any questions you may have
